info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued January 07 at 12:01PM MST until January 09 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM MONDAY TO 5 AM MST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 6 inches. Northerly winds gusting as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...Cheyenne County. * WHEN...From 5 AM Monday to 5 AM MST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on hazardous to impossible road conditions. Blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Strong winds could cause tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A small deviation in the track of the system may higher or slightly lower than current forecasted snowfall amounts. There also remains the potential that within the warning area that some swaths of higher snowfall amounts, potentially exceeding 12 inches are possible. Exact confidence in these specific areas are not known at this time. The highest snowfall totals in Cheyenne county are forecast east of Highway 59, this may be where the greatest impacts from strong winds and accumulating snow will lie.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
